website_summaries.verdict: For the golfer who wants their own personal backyard practice range, this golf net is the answer. 3-piece golf bundle comes with net, turf mat and carry bag.
pros: Assembles quickly and stands up to bad weather conditions
We like the fact it replaces going to the driving range and saves money on buying buckets of practice balls
cons: could be cumbersome for one person to pick up and move around
Power hitters might want to tread lightly to avoid tearing netting

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Net
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for looking for a net that was solid while easy to take up and down. This is a high quality unit and really fits the bill. All the parts fit together perfectly and are of high quality. It takes about 5 minutes to assemble. My first time using it I placed it in my garage, with the garage door down. I put it one foot away from the door to see if the net would hit the garage door during a shot. It did not. The ball comes back nicely to you off of the net (instead of getting tangled on the bottom). I'm glad I got this net.
customer_reviews.author: Deke

customer_reviews.title: Could probably hold 3 plus the ATV.
customer_reviews.text: A brother and sister couple with their kids moved into a trailer that sits adjacent to my hunting land. Since they moved in I noticed ATV tracks on some of my trails. We only ride Vespas when we hunt so definitely not our tracks. Since it is at the back of the property it takes a little time to get back there once I hear the ATV motor running, so I can never catch them in the act...Until now. Placed strategically on my trail on the other side of a blind curve, I caught the Dad and his mongoloid son the other night right in it. Perfect size net, for in breads.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Great net while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Great net while it lasted. One of the supports broke but after contacting the manufactorer they replaced it for free with no hassle. Excellent company and A+ customer service. Unfortunately the net started to have holes worn into it shortlu after I had the support replaced. This after about 1.5 seasons of use by just myself with about 30 minutes of use about 5 times a week over the course of 1.5 summers. It worked well but I think it should have lasted a little longer. I would buy another net from this company due to the great customer service but this one could have been better.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great hitting net for my garage. I use it to hit all clubs with real balls, SW-Driver, and haven't had any issues. Set up is easy, I did it myself in about 5 minutes. I had previously bought a cheaper net and it immediately broke. You can feel the quality in this one. The poles are thicker, the base is metal, and the net is higher quality. The one con would be that the net is slightly higher than advertised. I measured it at 7'8" so it just hits my garage door. And the balls will bounce away from you if it's set up on concrete.
customer_reviews.author: caseyg

customer_reviews.title: Returns Aren't Free
customer_reviews.text: Bought this net -- it looks great; exactly as advertised. It was a hair too large for the place I want to put it, so I had to return it. The advance measurements I took were very close to the dimensions of the net, and since it said "free returns" I decided to order it and see if I could squeeze it in. As I said, it didn't quite fit, but they are charging me $16 to return it. So much for "free returns"! Having said that, the net looks awesome. It's pretty heavy, but pretty easy to put up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: MNRBL

customer_reviews.title: Best quality net I've seen at this price-point
customer_reviews.text: Best quality net I've seen at this price-point, but may seem a bit small for those who may not feel confident about hitting consistently straight shots. Frame is sturdy and easy to assemble after the first "feeling-out" assembly. I did have a minor problem with my first assembly as one of the frame joints was slightly collapsed (probably during the metal cut). I just expanded/bent the frame joint to the correct size with a crescent wrench. I do not plan on leaving net installed for an extended period of time outside, as the AZ sun will shorten the life of any product, despite good initial quality.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher L. Dulawan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wait order now!
customer_reviews.text: Net is well constructed, definitely worth the money. I was leery about it catching the errant wide shot but you just slide over to compensate if needed, and the net is definitely wide enough. Just be aware, when setting it up on concrete, the ball bounces off the net and onto the ground, so the ball does bounce back to you. Doesn’t do that when setup on grass. Overall you can’t go wrong with this net. I regret not buying it much sooner. Thanks Rukket!
customer_reviews.author: SThaichareon

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to going to the range on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived well packaged with no damage. Instructions to assemble were clear and easy and took no more than 5 minutes to setup the first time. Metal base is made well and the thickness of the frame is just right to stabilize the net and support poles. I have hit regular golf balls and Callaway foam practice balls into the net and it performs as advertised. The travel case is a nice touch and is roomy enough to hold the net and a couple clubs and balls. Overall a quality product and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jbrewco

customer_reviews.title: Far exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded expectations. Set it up in no time in the garage and it works perfectly. Ball rolls right back to me. I would suggest getting the Rukett tri level matte as an addition. That way, you can hit every club in the bag and tee up your driver too. I hit 10 shots from every club every day and that alone has improved my swing and lag swing. You will instinctively know when you are hitting the sweet spots straight (and misses will come back to you off center as additional feedback. Save lot on range balls too.
customer_reviews.author: robert c jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first golf net for practicing at home and after a couple of sessions I find myself asking "what took me so long to get one"? Set-up is as easy and simple as it gets. I have a vision problem and I had it set up in less than 5 minutes. Tearing it down and putting everything back into the bag takes less than 3 minutes. Time will tell how the net holds up, but it appears to be well made and durable enough to handle every shot in your bag. If you're an avid golfer, this is an excellent set-up for backyard practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Duane23

customer_reviews.title: Just right for keeping your swing in tune!
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping and product was as described. The Haack went together quickly, with no tools. It is made of strong materials and should hold up a long time. I hit a couple of hundred balls into the net with every club in my bag. It caught them all with no indication the impact would damage the webbing. Overall, I am very happy with this purchase and hope it keeps my swing in tune. Thanks Rukket for making a great product made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Love it! Very well built! Easy to assemble! Works fantastic except center point of net is not 7 foot. It droops down so about 6 foot in center. Caused a few bad hits to go over top. Fortunately I use it in my garage and able to add two ropes to attach to center of net to pull it up to 7 foot. With that it works fantastic! So nice to go out daily and work on the golf game 20-30 minutes each day!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Don't Leave This Net Outdoors
customer_reviews.text: My 10x7 net was relatively easy to assemble and worked fine indoors for about four years. However, this past April I had to move it outdoors because the indoor space was no longer available, and it lasted about two months in the Texas sun and wind before the cloth loops that attach the net to the frame disintegrated. The net and the metal frame are still fine, but are now useless to me.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: It showed no signs of weakness like other cheaper nets
customer_reviews.text: I've hit into the net twice. The second time I went through all my clubs. I mention that because of the angle of the shot. The net was large enough hold all the shots. I hit my driver about 280-300 and the net had no problem hold the ball. It showed no signs of weakness like other cheaper nets. Long story short you get want to pay for so spend a little extra and get a good net.
customer_reviews.author: christopher f. howard

customer_reviews.title: Works Great. Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I have this set up in my garage. I am a fairly long hitter with swing speed around 105. I have no fear that the net will withstand anything that I can fire at it. It's pretty simple to set up; taking 20-30 minutes the first time and about 5-10 minutes once you know what you're doing. My only complaint is that the bottom will not retain balls when the net is set up on a hard surface as the balls bounce out over the 1-2" high lip. On the other hand, the balls bounce back on a very true line. This may not be the case if it's set up on a grass or other soft surface.
customer_reviews.author: Tom W

customer_reviews.title: the net seems to be pretty durable, as I have kept it up even ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a small to medium backyard because it has a slight slope. I was worried if the net would be too large in size to allow me to practice full swings... not a problem at all! This net fits perfectly in my yard and I am allowed to practice with ease. The net is wide enough to catch my ball slashes, which is my reason for wanting daily swing practice. Also, the net seems to be pretty durable, as I have kept it up even when it was raining outside. I definitely would recommend this golf net as a great alternative to days when you cannot make it to the driving range or for daily swing practice!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Ross

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This just went from 5 stars to 1 start really quick! I've had this outside for only 5 months and the net is already falling apart. I'm now having to use zip ties to hold the 'bungee' material to the outside liner fabric. I live in Fl so not harsh winter environment, but given what the sun can do here I don't expect the net to make it past 1 summer. Poor quality fabric has been used with this net.
customer_reviews.author: bptexas

customer_reviews.title: High Quality But Be On Your Toes
customer_reviews.text: This is high quality and works well. One thing you should know is that your ball will bounce back to you pretty quickly. If you're on grass, I'm sure it will roll up to you nicely. I'm on exterior tile with a hitting mat where the ball bounces to me and I have to catch it. I was under the impression the net would softly absorb the shot and it would roll down the net and then roll back to me. Not a deal-breaker but something you should know.
customer_reviews.author: NikNo

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: I used it about once a week, and kept it stored in the garage. It was great, worked well, caught the balls, etc. But in about one year, the red cloth binding tape around the perimeter of the net disintegrated and fell apart. This tape is what holds the net to the tensioning cord that tensions the net. The net is useless without that tape. So beware, you're getting about a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for golf practice and there was a hole in it within 3 months. He tied that up and now 2 months later there are two more holes. Our friend had the same net with the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Venerdi

customer_reviews.title: So much fun and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't wait to put it together, literally 10 minutes and so easy. Now if I could just get the kids off of it so I can hit some balls. Thinking this will pay for itself in a few weeks just on saving $$ by not going to the range, would suggest getting this with some sort of artificial turf mat so you don't hack up the yard. You can definitely use this inside or a garage if you have the room.
customer_reviews.author: mairob

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Haack Golf Net is way better than I expected !!! The bars that make up the base are the key to this nets performance !!! The net itself is a sturdy weave and has no problem absorbing the golf balls I have smashed into it. Yes smashed,, well in my world any way......I have just left it up in the back yard but can see its portability is a snap and the carrying case is perfect to toss in the trunk or back seat !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Right Choice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item after researching all the others. I have it set up outside for now but in the rainy winters of the Pac NW, I will have it in my garage. Everything about this set-up was well-thought. I only gave it four stars for durability because I've only had it about three weeks. I will update after the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Dumbbunny

customer_reviews.title: I am so disappoint as he was so excited to receive this gift ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband just opened his Father's day gift of the Rukket Golf net and while putting it together noticed the net was defective and frayed and totally unusable. I am so disappoint as he was so excited to receive this gift only to be disappointed by it. I still have to notify the company about a replacement net so I will update my review after I receive a new net. So far, bad impression. Friday update: I received the new net yesterday and spread it out on the floor, everything looks good so I am updating my review to 3 stars from my initial one star.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Incredible customer service
customer_reviews.text: We have had an issue with the golf net purchased in June of '18 and through several communications with the company our emails were answered almost immediately. James wanted nothing but to make my husband happy with their product and has replaced the net to this end. The net is highly rated but the company standing behind it gets my five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Vivien

customer_reviews.title: Home driving range
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this net for about a month and so far it’s doing great. No issues except for one of the connector pins was broken when I unpacked it. The item is under warranty so I will get a new one. But then it does a great job of catching the golf ball and actually rebounding it back to me. No issues with quality. Set this up on my back porch along with a piece of Monster Mat. Great combo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied. Easy to assemble/disassemble. I'm using it outdoors, but it has rubber feet and looks like it would work indoors very well. Might move it in the garage when its raining. The net appears to be very sturdy, although I think I'll probably add a towel in the "target" area to preserve its lifetime. And the 10x7 size is just right for me - big enough to catch errant balls but small enough to fit in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: DonL

customer_reviews.title: High quality golf net
customer_reviews.text: After unboxing, which conveniently had a quick start guide easy to find, the net went together exceedingly easy. Well thought out design. I gave it 4 stars because i worry about the vertical flex poles long term. I will update this review later good or bad. First impressions are all positive. Does what its supposed to do. Along with a good 3' x 5' golf practice mat, I now have a decent driving range in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hannifin

customer_reviews.title: Nice net
customer_reviews.text: I have used this net several times for practicing golf. It worked great. I did leave it out once for several days and when I used it again a ball pocked a hole in the net and the ball went right through. Fortunately it hit a tree and not my neighbors house. But overall, this is a good product and would recommend. Just put it away at night I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Ostler

customer_reviews.title: Ease of assemble and disassemble
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly as advertised. It is very easy to set up and assemble and disassemble. Seems to be durable when I use any of my golf clubs at full thrust. I can move it around in my garage easily because of the light weight construction. I highly recommend this practice net.
customer_reviews.author: golfnut

customer_reviews.title: Pleased so far.
customer_reviews.text: I've been really pleased with this hitting net so far. I've been getting swings in nearly every day with it. Easy to put together. No problems with quality so far. Balls just hit the net and roll down to the ground, walk up and retrieve. I set up only about 5 yards away. Its enough to be able to tell if your ball was well struck, but probably won't be enough to indicate hooks or slices. I love the convenience of being able to just walk into my backyard to get some swings in. Overall, its the next best thing to going to the range.
customer_reviews.author: TSG305

customer_reviews.title: Quick To Set Up Indoors our Out
customer_reviews.text: All the superlatives have been written elsewhere. I've got mine hanging with my driving mat at the ready. 3 minutes and I'm "at the range", and out of the weather ;) 6 months later...I have been using this net 3-4 times a week for several hours of practice each. Still as new as it was on day one. As others have commented, using on hard floors (aka concrete) the balls do tend to bounce. I purchased an anti-fatigue mat 2ft x 3ft and set it below the net, extending 6 inches in back and front of the resting portion of the net. Viola, the ball returns gracefully to the mat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Ok net, do not leave outside for too long.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one a few months ago and really loved it. It is a good golf net. However, the red trim that holds the net up disintegrated in the sun. I would not leave it set up outside for long. I ordered another for indoor use not realizing they claim a lifetime warranty. I tried the app to register the product but it is a poorly made app and had no luck. I deleted the app as I have too many useless apps on the phone. I think it’s a good net for indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: fabio a

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy yet easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the heavy duty components and the quality of the materials. It took about 30 minutes to assemble, but now that ive been through it once I'm sure that I'll be able to assemble the net in under 10 minutes the next time I do it. The net catches the ball (without any bounce back) and rolls it back. I'm very pleased with this purchase and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Russisright

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: Set it up in the back yard in the spring of 2019, held up to all of the wind and weather for the whole summer and into the fall. Took it down for the winter and stored in the garage and then set up again this spring (2020) didn't do as well in the spring wind and as of May the fiberglass poles are starting to crack and the top of the net has ripped so it is only about 5 feet tall instead of 7. Was easy to set up and we used it quite a bit for golf and baseball practice but I was hoping to get another year or two out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Golf Net!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well built golf net. I was impressed by the quality of the framing and that of the net. It is large and has no troubles stopping a shot. Pros: Quality of construction Size Ease of assembly Storage Bag Cons: Non that I can see yet Suggestions: For my use, I wish there was an option to have a small lip or tray on the bottom front to retain the balls hit into the net. I use this in my garage and often have to chase the ball down as the net springs it back at me.
customer_reviews.author: Smithers

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy, two minutes to set up (after a first couple attempts where I got the net either backwards or upside-down haha) and easy sixty seconds to tear down and store in bag. I live in Seattle and to avoid any weathering issues I tear it down if we're expecting rain. Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Louis I Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assembly also likes that the netting is looser ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband, he has given it the 4 stars. Easy to assembly also likes that the netting is looser than his old one which might make the netting last longer, you do have to lift the net to retrieve the balls but not a problem. Received on time.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product...does exactly as advertised (and well)
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I normally don't write reviews, but I have to tell you that I am pleased with the product. I had a few issues / frustrations with the assembly (instructions provided were not the same as what was online). Once that frustration was resolved, the net does a great job. In general, the ball comes back directly to me! Can't ask for anything more...nice job!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Christie

customer_reviews.title: Net is not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in the basement and practiced golf (mainly iron shots including wedges) once or twice a week. One day I heard that balls hit the wall passing through the net. Fortunately, there was no damage. Then, I noticed that there were few net damages (shown in the pictures). I had to install a piece of carpets behind the net holes. Overall the net was useful, but the quality was not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: JKS

customer_reviews.title: This net is awesome. The bag it comes in has extra space ...
customer_reviews.text: This net is awesome. The bag it comes in has extra space so it doesn't take much to put it back into the bag. The net sets up in a minute and tears down in the same time. I did have a small framing issue straight out of the box but it was an easy fix. One of the male pieces did not fit perfectly into the female end but it was nothing a couple of taps with a hammer couldn't fix. I haven't had that problem since. I would definitely recommend this net. It will be interesting to see how long the net actually last though
customer_reviews.author: M. James Jr

customer_reviews.title: My husband is in love
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Father’s Day and he promptly got it set up and outside to practice with it. It works perfectly! He used all of his different clubs with it and no golf balls wandered out from under the net like some products do. And it fits perfectly inside our garage so he can put it away at night without disassembling it. One of my best gifts yet!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: ... my short game in the winter and it works great. My short game deteriorates faster than the rest ...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this for my short game in the winter and it works great. My short game deteriorates faster than the rest of my game (not that I am any good) and this has really helped in the short time I've had it. I've set it up in my basement and have taken a number of full swings. It's great and as advertised. Consider the assembly instructions as hints on how to put it together! That was the only problem but not a big one.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Sher

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product! Less than 5 min to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product! Less than 5 min to assemble. I use it in my basement hitting golf balls with an optishot 2 golf simulator. One thing they should market is that it does not have to be 10' wide! you can leave out a section in the back, still connects together for solid support and make it's closer to 6' wide. Saves a lot of space and works great for me. I'm hitting balls into the net with all clubs. Driver is about 104 mph max and no ware at all. highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!!! STOP BUYING CHEAP NETS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wasted my time over the years buying cheap nets watching them quickly break down every season. This nets has lifetime replacement parts, is extremely easy to assemble, and is better built than any net that I've ever used. Well worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: K Yates

customer_reviews.title: it is fantastic and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Just as described...I have it set up in my basement. Took me a while to figure out how the net attaches and one of the metal poles would not slide into its companion pole without reversing it with another. Once put up (20 minutes?), it is fantastic and very sturdy...hit it as hard as you want with no fear of the ball going through the net and large enough to catch shanked balls (not supposed to use the S word). Great product...I highly recommend it. Oh yes, I did have to use a ladder to attach the net to the top while my wife supported the other side.
customer_reviews.author: Neal C.

customer_reviews.title: Very durable!
customer_reviews.text: My 65 pound dog accidentally ran full speed into the practice net. The net and stand absorbed the collision no problem, flexed back, and my puppy bounced back out no harm and kept running. This thing is super sturdy and pretty easy to setup and move.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Great net - high quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great net - I can set it up in about 3 minutes and tear it down in the same amount of time. It's easy to carry in its case and stores easily in my garage when I'm not using it. It seems to be very sturdy - it comes with some anchors to make sure it doesn't slide, but I don't use them and it doesn't move (I have it on grass) when you hit into it. Couldn't be happier and I also highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Grosch

customer_reviews.title: Product does not last
customer_reviews.text: Golf practice net. Works fine but netting has come loose from the rope holding the netting. The fabric wrapped around rope that holds the net and rope together has literally rotted away. This net was purchased in March so five months of use is what I got
customer_reviews.author: David A

customer_reviews.title: Missng part of net-corrected
customer_reviews.text: The item below was not in the box when I Received my Haack golf net. Features a size of 10ft W x 7ft H x 3ft D, includes FREE side barrier protection wings (in case of that errant shot) 6/10/15-update: I was quickly contacted after I answered an email from the company who said they would send the missing item free of charge. It's on it's way. I did setup the net and use it. Setup was easy. Breakdown was even easier. Product looks well made. Now I hope my golf game improves!!
customer_reviews.author: prov1

customer_reviews.title: Love This Thing
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly, quality materials, and great price. This thing can take a real beating. Crank shots as hard as you want to into this net, you can't hurt it. I have it set up in my 30X40 shop and hit from a large piece of artificial turf from about 10 feet away. Nine out of ten time you hit the ball into the net it come right back to you. Between my son and I, it will pay for itself within a couple of months because we won't have to go to the driving range as much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old son is working hard to earn a spot on his high school's varsity team. This net has allowed me to NOT go to the driving range everyday! He can't use it for his short irons because he hits them so high, so quickly that the net doesn't catch the ball, my neighbors yard does! However, 7 iron and up to driver, the net is awesome. Lightweight, easy to assemble and easy to move when the lawn guys come! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with my new simulator. I've use the net pretty much daily for about a year and it's now worn through. My next net will be more expensive, hopefully I'll get better performance. Update to 5*! They agreed to replace the net! You can't complain about that.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wark

customer_reviews.title: Great net!!!!!  Far better than competing products!!!
customer_reviews.text: My family and I have used golf nets on a daily basis for our indoor practice bay the last ten years. We have tried many different nets, and this is by far the best. Much easier to set-up than other nets, better built, better functionality, and great for indoor use as it is not as loud as the other nets that you have to hit into a hanging target. I am the type of person that will pay more for better quality, surprisingly this is the best quality on the market and less expensive than the nets by Callaway, Izzo, etc. If you are looking for a great net, this will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect net for heavy home use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this when in California. Back to British Columbia and just set it up recently. Works perfect and set-up is a breeze. Balls return to the flat surface and I set up an angle board that returns to the edge of my mat. Frame much more solid than my last net that just rotted away. Quiet and efficient.One happy camper!!! I had a problem with the net outer edging. I emailed through Amazon. Jon from Rukket got in touch with me immediately. He provide a replacement. They get a perfect 10 in customer satisfaction and backing up their product. Love the performance of the net, and such a treat to see a company that puts the customer first.
customer_reviews.author: Terry C, BC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Practice Net for Living in Colorado
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased as a Christmas gift for my husband. The packaging arrived on time and as expected in excellent condition, no blemishes or missing items. He just assembled it last night in our basement, we have about 10ft ceilings downstairs and the net was a perfect fit, quick and easy assembly. On a trial run with our toddler who has somewhat herculean strength and no restraint the net withstood his swings with little resistance. I have to say at this point that we are very pleased with our purchase, pictures to be posted at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Chaun

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the Rukket Net for a week, but I have used it 3 times already. I would have used it more, but the weather hasn't cooperated. The net is easier to set up than I thought it would be. It takes less than 5 minutes to put up or break down. It all fits in a carrying case. I read that some have had an issue with the net, I haven't. It's great to get swings in. I can't wait to see if it helps my game!
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Quality Practice Net - Totally Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great net. Once you have put it up the next time is a breeze. I can easily assemble it in less than 5 minutes by myself with little effort. Take down is also very easy. Quality material on the net so I would expect it to have along life and the included bag makes storage and transporting it a piece of cake. Overall, a well designed, quality practice net that I would totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great backyard net!
customer_reviews.text: Great net for the backyard! My son's golf coach recommended we get a net so he can practice without having to go to a driving range. We previously got the Izzo golf net and the Fiberglass sticks broke twice within the first two days. This golf net is easy to put up, and we have had it for two weeks now with no problems. Other reviewers had said the net is flimsy or poorly made but in our experience it's strong and the net doesn't take up that much floor space.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Wada

customer_reviews.title: Great product overall, only if you use it outdoor for about 8 months and discard it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product overall, only if you use it outdoor for about 8 months and discard it. Mine started fading right along the horizontal, top red cross bar due to Sun. See the pictures. The entire net is so saggy that it's useless for golf practice. We might throw it away if I can't find a remedy solution to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Prime Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great investment in your game!
customer_reviews.text: I hit a lot of balls and this net is simple, durable and works in the back yard, garage or anywhere you can swing a club. I added a target bought online for about 15 bucks to have an auditory response. Helps me keep my head down through impact and the sound identifies a solid shot. I have pounded my way through several competitor's nets and this is by far one of my top 3 nets for practice. It breaks down quickly and has a handy carry bag. Buy with confidence. Steve A - Boston
customer_reviews.author: Steve A  ~    Boston

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.text: The Rukket practice net is a well built, simple, rugged net. I have not found one thing that I do not like about it. I’ve only hit about a hundred balls into it but I can already tell it will help my game. You can tell how well you hit a ball by the way it feels and you can also get a good sense as to it’s flight by where it hits the net.
customer_reviews.author: Ann E

customer_reviews.title: Light, durable, awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Net and customer service are both Spectacular. Net performs exactly as described, it handles real golf balls at full velocity and barely budges. I expect many years of use ahead and cannot imagine ever replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Ownh

customer_reviews.title: Net is light, easy to set up and appears to work very well.  Good product.
customer_reviews.text: The ease of set up and take down is important, and works well with this product. Net is plenty high enough for even wedges. I can see how repeated ball hits in one spot could break the cords in the netting, so I plan on moving my mat around to vary the places where the balls hit. Overall, a great product and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JCC

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT GOLF NET FOR IRONS AND WOODS!
customer_reviews.text: This net appears to be very well built. It takes about 5 minutes to set up and take down and is fairly easy, although it took a bit longer the first time. The netting seems very strong, so I hit woods into it as well. This net does not come with the side nets that are shown in some videos, they have to be purchased separately. I'm not sure how necessary he side nets really are (unless someone hits really bad shots) as it seems to collect errant shots pretty well. I have it setup in my garage, it is very stable and does not move when I hit balls into it.I highly recommend this net for indoors or outdoors!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Smith

customer_reviews.title: Overall I believe I will be pleased with this net
customer_reviews.text: Had the net a couple weeks now but due to weather haven't had a chance till today to use it. Set up went fairly well for the first time. Now that I've done it should be able to set it up in less than 5 minutes. This product made it enjoyable to hit in the yard without chasing balls. Only glitch is minor, the back bar was slightly bent when I opened the package today. Didn't seem to cause any issues with set up or ability to stand. Overall I believe I will be pleased with this net. Good solution for those with limited space or don't feel like constantly spending money at a range.
customer_reviews.author: Renee DeLouche

customer_reviews.title: Fine product -- doing the job!
customer_reviews.text: I use this net plenty at my home in the USVI. and it's great and leave it up when I'm on island...comes with sides for shanks and heels, which I don't use, as the net is plenty big, for driver to lob wedge... the net is easy to set up - 5min - and performs very well with no complaints if I remember to start installation with the net in the right position. Good powder coat finish. Thanks Chris Haack -- you have a good product here. Suggestion: I live in a salty-air environment, so think about SS or aluminum for the future, even at a little higher cost.
customer_reviews.author: L'il Greener

customer_reviews.title: Great net! It took a few swings to gauge ...
customer_reviews.text: I received my Haack Golf Net last week. It took me about half an hour to read directions and set up the net. I'll be faster next time, probably less than 5 minutes now that I'm familiar with it. Great net! It took a few swings to gauge how close to stand for each club, but that was expected. I highly recommend this product. Swing away Merle. Incidentally, I also bought your fold out mat that is also a great product. It allows me to hit 3 different shot scenarios from one mat, rough (where I usually end up), fairway, and off the tee. Overall your products are great. Thanks, JB
customer_reviews.author: Namvet

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very pleased with the net. Easy to set up and tear down with a nice bag where everything fits nicely. I was pleasantly surprised to find out that when I am hitting balls into the net they roll out and right back to me if hit straight! I was expecting to be digging the golf balls out of the net after hitting a dozen or so. I have been practicing with one ball! The net and frame seem to be well built and I am expecting them to hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: James R Young

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: This net was easy for me set up. I’m 5’5 and bought it as a gift for my dad. I set it up by myself which was nice. When we are not using it we just take the net down and leave the base assembled. When it comes to driving it works great. My brother did hit it over the net some how. Oops. Lol. Just make sure it’s not facing any houses or windows.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy taking only 10 minutes or so. Construction quality appears to be quite good. I have been using this for over a month now with no complaints whatsoever. A benefit I hadn't thought of prior to purchasing was being able to easily compare the feel of different balls. Overall I am very satisfied and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: P. Meade

customer_reviews.title: Product is well engineered
customer_reviews.text: The product was simple to assemble and breaks down easily for storage. You can detach the top of the net in seconds when not in use. (It blew over the first night). Just be careful not to over stress the poles when doing so. The metal parts (base), poles and net are all heavy duty, and should last for years. I glued a piece of astroturf to a piece of (16" x 30") plywood to create a hitting mat to save my lawn. Drill a hole to insert a tee and it's good for drivers as well. I'm well pleased and can recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions but once you figure it out works great.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions could have been designed way better which is my biggest bad complaint. I had to go on You Tube to finally figure this out. Sorry but their website does not have a link anywhere I could find. Other than poor instructions, it worked great, light weight, easy to move around, and is perfect for our back yard.
customer_reviews.author: Warbucks

customer_reviews.title: Nice net
customer_reviews.text: I have had the net about a week now and it works great and seems to be well made. Due to snow I have only used it in the garage so far. My daughter and I have used every club in our bags and it catches the balls good. The ball return works good, unless you duff a shot and hit it low in the net. As others have mentioned the directions were not the greatest but it only took about 10 minutes to get it set up the first time. Set up and take down should only take a couple minutes now that I know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Nice net but fully pinned to ground blows over in ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice net but fully pinned to ground blows over in moderate wind purchased for my grandson he is 6 loves golf not using it much as I am afraid it may fall on him
customer_reviews.author: Lucille F.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and portability
customer_reviews.text: Bought for son who was starting to learn golf- super easy to set up ( time and time again)- and when leaving up for several days, no worry about rusting - It is very well made- excellent, strong weaving- thought it was a bit pricey but now realize it's worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Paulette H-

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, set up and take down in minutes. Comes with a large enough bag to fit everything in without stuffing it. Net is strong, and the net comes with a lifetime waranty. Cant beat the price for backyard practice. I live 25 miles to the nearest range, so this is perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great net
customer_reviews.text: assembly is super easy and quick. The net takes a lot of hits and even if it appears to be stretching out, it tightens back up over night. I've given this thing a lot of work and it's holding up very well. Zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Breedlove

customer_reviews.title: Where are the setup instructions with verbal videos
customer_reviews.text: The single sheet setup nstructions thha came wththe net were frustrating. I expect more from a company that prides itself with quality. Verbal videos work best. Once the net is setup it works as advertised
customer_reviews.author: William Ahlers

customer_reviews.title: Great ball return
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up, took 10 min with directions. The ball returns every time without having to walk to the net. Fit in our basement. Plenty of width and height to catch any shot (unless you shank one). Would be easy to take apart to move outside if needed.
customer_reviews.author: CCS

customer_reviews.title: Solid, sturdy net
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and the ball definitely returns to you, albeit a little faster than I like. As soon as I swing, I'm immediately looking down to ensure the ball doesn't go rolling past me. I think a baffler in the bottom of the net might help with that. I'll have to try that... To be completely fair, this is indoor in my garage, so there's nothing to damper the effect coming off the net.
customer_reviews.author: P.J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality practice net for the price. It was easy to set up and does a great job at stopping the balls I hit at it. I used practice balls and regular golf balls, and the net had no problem stopping the regular golf balls, no matter how fast the balls come at it. doesn't get pushed around by the wind and seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kim

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to practice my swing at home. Came in on time, and not damaged. Easy setup, took maybe 3 minutes and that’s only because it was hot outside. Net doesn’t seem super durable but I guess we will see how it goes. It is a little difficult to move by yourself but where there’s a will there’s a way. Paired this with a Motivo golf mat and am super happy.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Crowder

customer_reviews.title: This one's a winner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great net! We read multiple reviews before selecting a net and it really payed off. We were looking for a good quality net that would hold up a long time and wouldn't fray and fall apart... this net fit the bill! It took 2 of us to put it up only because our arms weren't long enough. Putting it up the first time took less than 10 minutes and now that we know how it takes only a couple of minutes. The balls stay contained and don't roll under the net. It is stable enough to stay standing in light winds.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: rain and pretty muddy conditions in the yard
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a gift for my husband. He loves it but he has not been able to use it yet. The weather has been snow, rain and pretty muddy conditions in the yard. He is looking forward to trying this gadget out to improve his golf swing. Out of the box and put together as of now. Just waiting on the weather to cooperate
customer_reviews.author: chili mama

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly suits my needs. Easy setup and takedown. Probably takes about 3 minutes to set up. I use it almost every day and take it down and store it in the convenient bag after each use so it doesn't clutter my yard and it's almost zero work. Really great product, happy with my purchase. I've hit about 2100 balls into it at this point, that's 21 trips to the range at $10 a pop, so it's already paid for itself. Highly recommend a swing analyzer to accompany this as you won't get an exact read on your ball flight. But all in all a great tool to keep the rust off your swing or just save some money on practicing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great hitting net
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think I could get a net of this quality at this price. I really like it. If you hit off a mat on a hard surface, this net will return the ball to you. It's pretty amazing. I think it was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Xman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and take down
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a net that I could put up and take down in a few minutes that was also fairly large. This net checks all the boxes. It takes about 3 minutes to set up and about half of that to take down. It also provides plenty of coverage for all types of shots, including wedges. I often drop the net and hit my wedges to targets rather than into the net, but I've also left the net up so I'm not chasing the balls.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Williams

customer_reviews.title: Practice in your backyard
customer_reviews.text: Instead of driving to the driving range to practice, I can now walk in my backyard and hit balls anytime I want. The extra practice is paying off and my game is definitely improving. Easy to set up and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: James F Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome net once you get past the assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.text: very nice net, as I have set up and hit several hundred balls into it already. Seems to be no fraying or damage to the net. I anticipate it will last for years. It is very easy to set up and take down, so very portable. My only issue was the directions for the first time assembly. They were horrible. It took me 15 minutes of reading and re-reading the instructions for what ended up being so easy. I would highly recommend that they revise the instructions, but once you do it once...it takes 1 minute to put together. Very nice and high quality. I would recommend this net.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Flack

customer_reviews.title: Utilizing "Almost Golf" balls and this net has been one of the best things I and my family can do for our ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my back pool deck. Utilizing "Almost Golf" balls and this net has been one of the best things I and my family can do for our game. Well constructed and easy set up. You cant beat this net for hitting balls after work....this net catches all the balls and is great for a warm up till you hit the course. Easy set up and take down. I highly recommend this net to anyone who wants to free themselves from a driving range and have the luxury of hitting balls on your own terms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great net. Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: First net I ever bought. Like it a lot. Great size. Set up in my garage because of current weather. Have been hitting into it for a week....both plastic and real balls..First time set up took less than 5 mins......now maybe 2, although I leave the lower frame together. Returns plastic balls fine, but makes regular balls bounce on the concrete so sometimes you have to chase them before they roll under some garage fixture and are difficult to dig out. Probably have hit 200 balls into it over this last week. Did quite a bit of research before buying and there are other good nets out there I'm sure, but I would recommend this one to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Its a good size but is still small enough that we can ...
customer_reviews.text: My son received this as a christmas gift. Its a good size but is still small enough that we can fit it in our unfinished basement so he can practice during the winter when the driving range is closed. We also purchased with Rukket Tri- Turf portable mat to go along with the it. Both my son and husband are enjoying this net.
customer_reviews.author: L Hass

customer_reviews.title: Net is not durable as described.
customer_reviews.text: Cannot last long. After one year hit, the net is broken already . I recommended many friends to buy. However the quality is not that good .
customer_reviews.author: SY Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Bringing the convenience of a driving range to my backyard.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to golf and eager to learn and took some lessons. I knew the best way to keep advancing was to keep working on my swing. I have several driving ranges around but this is better! If I have free time I walk out my backdoor and practice. Easy to setup and paired with Rukket mat I have a driving range in my own backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Ptbrit

customer_reviews.title: Best Swing Net
customer_reviews.text: High Quality Swing Net. I have owned other brands of nets. This one and this brand exceeded all of my expectations and then some. Not worth going for the cheaper nets, this net is worth the premium. Can handle any swing speeds you throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: DISCover Tunes

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great company
customer_reviews.text: I have had this net for 3 years and absolutely love it!! Well made -I use it all the time and this is an American company who stands behind their product-they replaced a part for free when it went after 3 years of use!!
customer_reviews.author: panda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality construction, assembly instructions lack detail
customer_reviews.text: The net appears to be of good quality materials and works as designed. I did not install the 'Free' side netting. It takes up too much space in the yard and would be annoying to move when I have to mow the lawn. Assembly was not as fast and easy to figure out as I would have expected. It would have been easier if the ends of the metal pieces were labeled or if the pictures on the instructions were photographs instead of drawings. All in all, happy with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: I was happy to see such good reviews from Amazon customers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Haach Golf Net for my husband as a gift. I was happy to see such good reviews from Amazon customers; however, from reading all the comments, I was somewhat apprehensive that the net would difficult to assemble. I asked my husband and he said that it was not a problem. All parts were clearly labeled as A>B, and C>D. Perhaps the manufacturer has started labeling due to past assembly complaints from buyers. The net receives a lot of "hits" and is holding up very well. I would recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Baxter

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, easy set up, and easy take down by myself. Net works as it should. Bag is large enough where you don't need to worry about jamming in the netting. Plenty of room in the carry case. Will of course register product for lifetime warranty on parts. Huge bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Goodreau

product_meta.title: Rukket 10x7ft Haack Golf Net | Practice Driving Indoor and Outdoor | Golfing at Home Swing Training Aids | by SEC Coach Chris Haack
feature_bullets: Endorsed by SEC coach Chris Haack, "We bring the range to you. This will be the last net you'll ever need."
ROCK-SOLID NET: Rukket's 4-ply knotless netting can take a beating with an effortless ball roll back feature. Get more swings out of your practice!
EFFORTLESS: fast & easy setup/breakdown. Lightweight and portable, practice anywhere, anytime! Come with a durable carry bag.
SAFELY PRACTICE: large area to collect even an errant shot at 10ft W x 7ft H x 3ft D. Hit each shot with confidence knowing the Haack Net will catch and return the ball to you.

LIFETIME WARRANTY: Buy with confidence from Rukket Sports. Click 'Add to Cart' and get the best product and customer service on the market. The Rukket Fair Play Guarantee and our lifetime warranty protect you from any issues.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
